instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.D7701: What is D7701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.Q7706: What is Q7706? Q7706 takes PPBUS_G3H's main 12.6v and sends it through to the backlight circuit. If Q9706 is not allowing PPBUS_G3H through, you will get no voltage on the backlight circuit. Q7706 is a P channel MOSFET, meaning power will flow through it when the voltage on the gate is lower than on the source. Look at pin 3. R7788 takes the 12.6v that is on the source and places it right on pin 3. This will set Q7706 to "off", and not allow it to pass power, as the voltage on the source and the gate are identical..
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: Late 13 3662 no bklt
threads.message: Have a late 13 3662 with no back light and MagSafe stays orange (no charge in battery) history is that water from a faucet dropped on Apple logo over some time. Display works fine, backlight does not.  pin 1 at lcd bkltboost registered 0v. No real corrosion on board. Do you think it could simply be the screen itself even with 0v at lcd bklt s0? Do you think the no chargen is somehow related? I already checked/replaced lcd bklt chips. Ideas?

threads.title: Late 13 3662 no bklt
threads.message:
First check resistance to ground (diode mode, red probe to ground) at pin1 /J8300.
Also check if same pin has conitnuity to pin K/<DIODE>D7701</DIODE>.

Did you check F7700?
Post some voltages and signals for <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>, pins 5, 18, 17, 11.

threads.title: Late 13 3662 no bklt
threads.message: I will check. My other question is, is there a way to reliably test a screen backlight without getting a new one? I am out of known good, am at a down point in cash flow so can?t buy a known good and cant afford to take the hit of buying a new one if it?s indeed not the problem.

threads.title: Late 13 3662 no bklt
threads.message:
Some measurments can help you to discard between MLB and LCD assembly; but not always possible 100%.
You need to have at least a broken screen, with good backlight.
Better if you can get some areas with image on it.

threads.title: Late 13 3662 no bklt
threads.message:
Resistance to ground at pin 1 is 1.23 with screen unplugged. 0 with screen plugged in (suggest short in screen?)
Continuity from pin 1 to <DIODE>D7701</DIODE>- Yes
F7700- good voltage to both sides
<CHIP>U7701</CHIP>:
  Pin 5: 5.03V
  Pin 18: 5.03V
  Pin 17: 3.3V
  Pin 11: 12.5V

Think the resistance to ground with the screen plugged in vs unplugged, plus good voltages suggests bad screen?

threads.message:
Resistance to ground at pin 1 is 1.23 with screen unplugged. 0 with screen plugged in (suggest short in screen?)
Continuity from pin 1 to <DIODE>D7701</DIODE>- Yes
F7700- good voltage to both sides
<CHIP>U7701</CHIP>:
Pin 5: 5.03V
Pin 18: 5.03V
Pin 17: 3.3V
Pin 11: 12.5V

Think the resistance to ground with the screen plugged in vs unplugged, plus good voltages suggests bad screen?

threads.title: Late 13 3662 no bklt
threads.message:
You get short on backlight rail only when screen is plugged.
So bad screen, or video cable.
You must try other LCD assembly.

Look at the LCD connector.
An internal damage can cause a short even when good screen is connected (less probably).

threads.message: [USER="682"]2informaticos[/USER] Got a known good... still has image, but no bklt... :-?

J8300, <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7706</TRANSISTOR>...

threads.title: Late 13 3662 no bklt
threads.message:
[U][B]J8300 [/B][/U]
P1: 0V

[B][U]<CHIP>U7701</CHIP>:[/U][/B]
P5: 5V
P18: 5V
P17: 3.3V
P11: 12.42V

[B][U]<TRANSISTOR>Q7706</TRANSISTOR>[/U][/B]
P1,2,5,6: 0V
P3: 12.5V
P4: 12.6V

Looked in J8300 and it looks fine.

threads.title: Late 13 3662 no bklt
threads.message:
Are you using original 85W Magsafe 2 charger?
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signal.
